quoteFirst: At noon the Battle Fleet was in position Lat. 55.42 N., Long. 1.04 E. steering south-south-east. Submarines were sighted by the cruiser _Minotaur_ at 1.23 P.M., and by the light cruiser _Boadicea_ at
quoteLast: ; both these ships were in the vicinity of the Battle Fleet which was man≈ìuvred as necessary to avoid the submarines; this caused some slight delay in the southward movement.
title: The Grand Fleet, 1914-1916
author: Jellicoe, John Rushworth, 1859-1935
